Year Date Event
100 BC 13 July Gaius Julius Caesar, the famous Roman military commander and politician, was born.
The Social War began between Rome and its Italian allies over citizenship rights.
63 BC Birth of Octavius (later Emperor Augustus).
27 BC 13 January The Roman Senate granted Octavius the title "Augustus", marking the beginning of the Roman Empire.
5 February Augustus celebrates his birthday, the day before the traditional celebration day.
The First Triumvirate is formally dissolved, ending the dominance of Caesar, Pompey, and Crassus.
14 AD 19 August Death of Emperor Augustus. Tiberius becomes Emperor.
33 AD Crucifixion of Jesus Christ (according to Christian tradition).
Summer Persecution of Christians begins under Emperor Tiberius.
79 AD 24 August Mount Vesuvius erupts, destroying Pompeii and Herculaneum.
